AAAYSggBAACGEkIAAIChhBAAAGAoIQQAABhKCAEAAIYSQgAAgKGEEAAAYCghBAAAGEoIAQAAhhJCAACAoYQQAABgKCEEAAAYSggBAACGEkIAAIChhBAAAGAoIQQAABhKCAEAAIYSQgAAgKGEEAAAYCghBAAAGEoIAQAAhhJCAACAoYQQAABgKCEEAAAYSggBAACGEkIAAIChhBAAAGAoIQQAABhKCAEAAIYSQgAAgKGEEAAAYCghBAAAGEoIAQAAhhJCAACAoYQQAABgKCEEAAAYSggBAACGEkIAAIChhBAAAGAoIQQAABhKCAEAAIYSQgAAgKGEEAAAYCghBAAAGEoIAQAAhhJCAACAoYQQAABgKCEEAAAYSggBAACGEkIAAIChhBAAAGAoIQQAABhKCAEAAIYSQgAAgKGEEAAAYCghBAAAGEoIAQAAhhJCAACAoYQQAABgKCEEAAAYSggBAACGEkIAAIChhBAAAGAoIQQAABhKCAEAAIYSQgAAgKGEEAAAYCghBAAAGEoIAQAAhhJCAACAoYQQAABgKCEEAAAYSggBAACGEkIAAIChhBAAAGAoIQQAABhKCAEAAIYSQgAAgKGEEAAAYCghBAAAGEoIAQAAhhJCAACAoYQQAABgKCEEAAAYSggBAACGEkIAAIChhBAAAGAoIQQAABhKCAEAAIYSQgAAgKGEEAAAYCghBAAAGEoIAQAAhhJCAACAoYQQAABgKCEEAAAYSggBAACGEkIAAIChhBAAAGAoIQQAABhKCAEAAIYSQgAAgKGEEAAAYCghBAAAGEoIAQAAhhJCAACAoYQQAABgKCEEAAAYSggBAACGEkIAAIChhBAAAGAoIQQAABhKCAEAAIYSQgAAgKGEEAAAYCghBAAAGEoIAQAAhhJCAACAoYQQAABgKCEEAAAYSggBAACGEkIAAIChhBAAAGAoIQQAABhKCAEAAIYSQgAAgKGEEAAAYCghBAAAGEoIAQAAhhJCAACAoYQQAABgKCEEAAAYSggBAACGEkIAAIChhBAAAGAoIQQAABhKCAEAAIYSQgAAgKGEEAAAYCghBAAAGEoIAQAAhhJCAACAoYQQAABgKCEEAAAYSggBAACGEkIAAIChhBAAAGAoIQQAABhKCAEAAIYSQgAAgKGEEAAAYCghBAAAGEoIAQAAhhJCAACAoYQQAABgKCEEAAAYSggBAACGEkIAAIChhBAAAGAoIQQAABhKCAEAAIYSQgAAgKGEEAAAYCghBAAAGEoIAQAAhhJCAACAoYQQAABgKCEEAAAYSggBAACGEkIAAIChhBAAAGAoIQQAABhKCAEAAIYSQgAAgKGEEAAAYCghBAAAGEoIAQAAhhJCAACAoYQQAABgKCEEAAAYSggBAACGEkIAAIChhBAAAGAoIQQAABhKCAEAAIYSQgAAgKGEEAAAYCghBAAAGEoIAQAAhhJCAACAoYQQAABgKCEEAAAYSggBAACGEkIAAIChhBAAAGAoIQQAABhKCAEAAIYSQgAAgKGEEAAAYCghBAAAGEoIAQAAhhJCAACAoYQQAABgKCEEAAAYSggBAACGEkIAAIChhBAAAGAoIQQAABhKCAEAAIYSQgAAgKGEEAAAYCghBAAAGEoIAQAAhhJCAACAoYQQAABgKCEEAAAYSggBAACGEkIAAIChhBAAAGAoIQQAABhKCAEAAIYSQgAAgKGEEAAAYCghBAAAGEoIAQAAhhJCAACAoYQQAABgKCEEAAAYSggBAACGEkIAAIChhBAAAGAoIQQAABhKCAEAAIYSQgAAgKGEEAAAYCghBAAAGEoIAQAAhhJCAACAoYQQAABgKCEEAAAYSggBAACGEkIAAIChhBAAAGAoIQQAABhKCAEAAIYSQgAAgKGEEAAAYKiFf3r45M60DQAA8AQr5f8PAga9KGHHXfkAAAAASUVORK5CYII=






Sometimes during play, your character will happen across a situation where the task or action is either exceptionally consuming or draining on your character’s abilities and resources.  In these instances, the GM may use the ''burn'' mechanic. If burn reduces the number of dice in your pool to less than zero, you do not succeed on the dice roll.

Burn mechanics reduce the number of dice in a dice pool by their stated value.  Typically, the value of the burn is stated immediately after the word burn itself.  Examples include “burn 2 dice” or “burn 1”.  It is uncommon for burn to be 2, and rare for it to be greater.  The GM may choose the greatest source of burn instead of using the sum of the burns if there are multiple sources.

Common cases for burn mechanics include targeting something out of reach or range, trying to shoot a target behind light cover (burn 1) or heavy cover (burn 2).  Environments can also come into play as a source of burn.  Examples include running on a lubricated surface or acting on ill-conceived or incorrect information.







Runner names are important as elaborated previously. Following is a list of names that fit within the theme of and setting of the Texaplex.

!!#
12 Gauge, 7azer, 

!!A - D
Akira, Apple pie, Bad Hoss, Banjo, Beast, Big #, Big Red, Biscuit, Black Mamba, Bo, Bobbie, Boy, Booter, Buckshot, Cash, Cat 5, Chill, Cherry Red, Compact, Coyote, Crash, Deeks, DOS Boot

!!E-M
Eddy, Figure 8, Galactose, Geronimo, GH0ST, Grit-man, Haxor, Hound-dog,  Ice, Jericho, Johnnie, Joy-boy, Joystick, Joy-toy, Jumbo, Kun-Chan, Lassie, Leet,  Mad dog, Mamushi, Mochi, Moe Damn, Moji, Mr. Knuckles, Mrs. Grips

!!N-S
Netmask, Necio, Numlock, Ocho-dos, Over-cooked, Pathfinder, Piece-man, Queso-breath, Raildog, Rat catcher, Razor wire, Scrub, Shift, Snow Job, Sidewinder, Spicy Ketchup, Spirit, Sparky, Sporks, Sweet Pickles, Sweet Tea, Switch,

!!T-Z
Tail pipe, Texas Red, The Cleaner, The Unit, Tornado, Twister, Two-body, Uno, Valkyrs, Vamos, Vaquero, Whey, War-hatch, White Hawk, Wissles, Xibit, Yak, Yama, Zero, Zig-Zag, Zipper, Zooner,








09/17/2020

#Added [[Chems]]'s body text and Started working on the [[Chems Catalog]].
#Created pixel art draft of Book Cover idea 1.

09/07/2020

*Original static fork of playtest version 0 created






Choose from the following list of starting ''archetypes'':

* [[Cowboy|Cowboys]] – an in-universe equivalent to the hacker, who races across [[Cyberspace]] manipulating data and running programs to gain access to secured systems and data vaults.
* [[Grease|Greases]] – Experts of getting in and out of places.  If you need a person to find the easiest way in or a speedy get away, a grease has the freedom of movement required.
* [[Razor Girl|Razor Girls]] – a quick and lethal killer that prefer light weapons and the quieter approach.  They’re cybernetic reflexes and wits on the job keep them alive.
* [[Samurai]] – a big cybered-out combatant that specializes in big damage in large volumes.  With the sense of honor that they typically have, they aren’t keen to shun a loud upfront approach, and approve of heavy arms and armor.
* [[Teked|Tekeds]] – a rogue technical specialist that is the best on the street at fixing, running, and taking care of people and gear. They specialize at one thing but end up being good at many.
* [[Voice|Voices]] – A smooth talker that has a way with their silver tongue.  They use pretty faces and sharp words to get things done.  They have a way with style all on their own.

You can choose and customize your character later.  The starting archetype is just to get you started. Each starting archetype will have a list of abilities and foci.  You will need to choose one list of each and record it on your character record.  Additionally, each archetype is associated with a sort of gear and equipment.  A list of associated gear is provided as a starting suggestion but does not include all the game mechanics provided.  You will need to purchase gear later.  Lastly, each archetype has a selection of skills called [[Exploits]]; cool things, exceptions, and rule breaking mechanics associated with an archetype.  Of course, you can acquire exploits outside your archetype later.







Describe your character in a single sentence or two. Try to conceptualize your character based off of who you want them to be, what group they might be a part of, what traits are noteworthy, or something they are doing, want to do or have done.

Another way to generate a ''character concept'' is to use the multitude of random character concept generators found on line.  In either case, the concept is not binding and is free to change during both creation and play.  Do be careful and communicate any changes made to your character’s concept. The GM and other players might make their own choices based off your concept and character.
The following are examples of a few character concepts:

* A roguish driver escaping from the reach of a criminal organization
* A young hacker learned everything they know from the Net, and who’s online friends are vanishing.
* A nude-bar bartender that moonlights as a runner to enact vengeance on a criminal gang.
* An older street warrior who is out looking for another street warrior they used to know.







As a [[regular player|The Other Players]], your character is your means of altering and developing the narrative. Follow the step-by-step guides and explanations as you read to create your own player character. Make sure to accurately record each our choices on a piece of paper, which will become your character record. An example [[Character Record|V0.2 Chromodrome CharRecord.pdf]] is provided.

"""
Step 1: [[Character Concept|Character Concepts]]
Step 2: [[Character Style|Character Styles]]
Step 3: [[Character Archetype|Character Archetypes]]
Step 4: [[Character Customization|Customization]]
Step 5: [[Character Name|Naming a Character]]
"""






See [[Style Points]] for the character statistics, of which you start with and have a maximum of 43.

Select a style that your character starts the game with.  The universal styles are listed below: 

* [[Corpos]]
* [[Cyberpunks]]
* [[Denims]]
* [[The Glitz]]
* [[Goths]]
* [[Guzzlers]]
* [[Punkeis]]
* [[The Ones]]

Your character’s sense of style matters a lot in [[The Texaplex]].  The words you use, the clothes you wear, the people you associate with, and the actions you take all inform others about your your identity, your roots and what your values and beliefs are. There are too many people and too much going on to spend enough time to get to know anyone, so style fills in the large gaps. Sure, it might be shallow and prejudicial, but it works for the most part.  Why spend half-an-hour getting to know someone when you can just look at their tattoos, clothes, or how they talk, and you’ll have a nearly complete image of what a person wants and what it is they do every day?

!! Style as an Identity
Corps won’t walk around with a Punkei haircut, and a Glitz wouldn’t wear the dark heavy fabrics of the Goth every day. That's because style is a choice, either chosen by you or the group you want to be in with. It's an identifier. A wage slave wears a suit to keep a job or look like management material. A woman shaves her head violates the norms of conservative femininity. A Cyberpunk installs a permanent VR set into their face to distance themselves from real and make it easier to delve into [[The Net]].

That’s because style doesn’t just make a character look a particular way, it solidifies and forms a major part of your character’s self-identity and what they do.  It is also used by other’s to identify your player character.  It helps characters set expectations about a character’s character, socio-economic state, culture or group identity, and other affiliations and beliefs.  Sometimes this can be to dangerous effect.

!! Identity Protection
Unfortunately, people like their style and they hangout with those of their own style. This does lead to sort of tribal and collective mentality among everyone, but that has always been something human. If you insult one Punksei’s hair, you’ve insulted every Punkei’s hair. Not because you challenged their style, but also their identity and beliefs as well.  And some styles are just diametrically opposed to one another, their beliefs and styles don't fuse. Only an outside force can make Corpos and Guzzlers mix. You should never wear too much cotton to a Cyberpunk bar. And never be surprised is violence erupts when The Glitz invade a Goth club for a [[SimStim|SimStims]].

!! Substyles
Within each style are various sub styles each with their own sense of belonging. Often times substyles are focused and maintained by a certain personality. Common examples are the tattoos of a particular [[ShadowBiz|ShadowBizs]], Guzzlers' special patches and paints, Corpo fashion designer brands.

!!Effects on Socalizing
Styles, each with their own attached identities and beliefs, don't always agree with one another. Sometimes they do. The prejudices based on these styles com into play with socializing. Reflect on the following table to determine burns and edges for social abilities rolls.

|Styles have edge within themselves |c
| ... has ... on ... |<|<|
|!Style |!Edge |!Burn |
|Corpos |The Glitz |Guzzlers, Punkeis |
|Cyberpunk |The Ones |Corpos, Denims |
|Denims |Punkeis |Cyberpunks |
|The Glitz |Cyberpunk, The Ones |Goths, Punkeis |
|Goths | - |The Glitz |
|Guzzlers |Punkeis |Corpos |
|Punkeis |Cyberpunk, Denims, Guzzlers |Corpos, The Glitz |
|The Ones |Cyberpunk, The Glitz | - |







''Charm'' is a measure of a character’s social abilities and conduct.  It does not include social graces, but instead measures their social abilities in whatever social group or culture they or their target belongs to.  Charm focuses on the positive social actions, such as compliments, knowledge of slang, conformity, and entertaining. Smooth talkers as well as more diplomatic characters have higher Charm scores.






''Chems'' are the tiny chemicals taken in dosage by so many of the populace of [[The Texaplex]]. Corpos take them to be productive at work, Denims use them to expand their minds, and the Glitz take them to juice their SimStims recording with heightened senses. Chems in general are used to keep up with the expectation of society or to get an edge in survival. for [[Jobber]], chems may be the edge they need to get a job done when death or worse is on the line.

Each chem offers a situational edge for it described behavior or action. Actions that don't fall within that behavior typically suffer burn on any rolls. '''Preemo'' chems, the higher quality chems, grant additional benefits, one time use exploits, or have lesser withdrawal effects. These have a corresponding higher [SC|Street Cred]] cost. see the description of each chem and their preemo to learn more, or just use them and find out from personal experience.

Never take ''Dog-Tier'' chems. They wreck your system harder than the other shit. When you suffer burn due to dog-tier chems you suffer 2 burn rather than 1.

See [[Chems Catalog]] for the price and effects of the various chems available on the street.

!!Addiction 

All but a few chems are habit forming, others are addictive. Hard core users call their withdrawals chem deficiencies, because without them they can't live a normal feeling life. These addictions form 4 levels: 0 through 3. The higher the addiction level, the more often you must use the chem or otherwise suffer the negative effects of withdrawal.  Each character, unless others decided, starts with level 0 addiction in all chems.


!!Being Addicted
*At addiction 0, you suffer no negative consequences from not regularly taking the chem.
*At addiction  1, you suffer burn on all your rolls if you go longer than 1 week without consuming the chem.
*At addiction  2, you suffer burn on all your rolls if you go longer than 3 days without consuming the chem.
*At addiction  1, you suffer burn on all your rolls if you go longer than 1 day without consuming the chem.

Each chem has an addiction score that represents the number successes required on a [[Hearty]] roll to not become more addicted to the chem. On a failure, your addiction score level, up to a maximum of 3. At the end of each day while suffering the effects of withdrawal, you may make a Hearty roll to reduce your addiction level.






Each chem listed below, unless otherwise stated costs 1 [[SC|Street Cred]], while preemo variants have a cost of 2. each chem has the following effects:

!!!!Aid I(//special//, alter time (1hr), dependent, finite uses (1), single target) Burn(//special//)

This grants strong edge on a particular cluster of actions found in each description of the chems. Preemo drugs grant an additional exploit, available only while under the effects of the preemo drug.

!! __''Amp''__

A chem that keep you going. You gain edge on repetitive actions. this effect lasts for one hour. Users experience fidgityness and excitement under it's effects, and suffer 1 burn when taking a new action.

//''Preemo: ''//regain 1 SP at the end of each of your turns while under the effects of the drugs.

!! __''Bliss''__
A chem that keeps you positive and light. You are better able to instill positive responses into others and withstand aggressive action sand threats against you.

//''Preemo:'' //Once per use of the chem, you can declare, before you roll, the number of success on a positive social roll.

!! __''Comet''__
A chem that increases your major muscles control. you gain edge on rolls of running, physical feats of prowess that center on or require movement.

''//Preemo://'' Once per round, you can run a short distance on your turn as a free action while under the effects of the chem.

!! __''Crush''__
!! __''Knockout''__
!! __''Lag''__
A chem that effects long term memory, at the cost of short term memory. You suffer burn while trying to remember things that occur while under the effects of Lag while under the effects, but gain edge when trying to remember the effects while no longer under it's effects.

//''Preemo:''// For the next week after the effects of the Lag wear off, you can choose to remember one event with near perfect clarity once.

!! __''Moon rocks''__
!! __''Black Noise''__
Your sensorium become super focused. This chem focuses the mind on one subject at a time, giving pinpoint attention at the cost of loosing peripheral attention. While under it's effects, you gain edge on one perception of a small object or target in your view or range of senses, you suffer a burn on attentiveness to anything else.

//''Preemo:''// Once per use, you are able to expand your focus to your entire surroundings without loosing your edge or suffering burn for it.

!! __''Nova-coke''__
!! __''Radiation''__
Body becomes covered in fuzzy pricks and experience a loss of pain. Once the effects wear off, people describe the pain coming back to them with a vengeance as their bodies pain receptors begin misfiring. Reduce damage taken by 3 while taken under the effects, but suffer the sum of all reduced damage after the effects of radiation have worn off. Experience burn on all actions that effect fine touch or manual manipulation.

//''Preemo:''// You only take half the damage reduced during the effects once the effects have ended. 

!! __''Sugar''__
So called because it makes the user sweet and 
Edge - seduction
Burn - aggression

!! __''Songbird''__
!! __''Space Mushrooms''__
A genus of mutant psychoactive mushrooms originated from radiated zones from Europe, space mushrooms deliver a euphoric experience and de-personalization allowing for excited mental experiences often accompanied with visual hallucinations. Some cowboys equate the experience of being fully immersed in the Net as being under the effects of space mushrooms. You gain edge on mental actions, but suffer burn on physical actions and resisting fear and intimidation.

//''Preemo:''//

!! __''Whizz''__
The strongest and dangerous way to supercharge your central nervous system, whizz is  stimulant like no other. You gin edge on alertness, reaction times and muscle strength as your body works in over time. You gain burn of speach and alertness based on vision (this amounts to burn and edge on perception rolls that rely on sight).

//''Preemo:''// Once per use, you may decide to take an additional action immediately following another character's turn while under the effects of whizz.

!! __''Wrath''__
Edge on aggression and physical violence, burn on everything else.

//''Preemo:''// Deal an additional 3 damage on physical attacks.

!! __''Xp''__	
If you complete a job while under the continuous effects of Xp, you gain an addition 3 SC. If you do not, your reward for the job is reduced by 5. Cumulative uses of SP does not increase this reduction, but does increase the additional SC reward and the time to complete the job.

"Preemo:" You do not receive a reduction in SC for failing to complete the job while under the effects of the preemo Xp.

!! __''Zarathrustrian Hash''__
A family of strains of marijuana derived from plants germinated and irradiated in low Earth orbit. Users  experience an emotional receptiveness that some amount to a religious experience. It is often used by Nova-age religions as a means of perceiving your next life in the world cycle. You gain edge on all empathy rolls or rolls made to under stand others. You suffer burn on acts of aggression or divisiveness.






[[Block Generation|F: Block Generation]]: Step 1

Most People are not going to know everything about texas and it's different parts and cultures. If you are familiar with 10th and Lincoln in [[Austin|Austin-San Antonio]], Deep Ellum in [[Dallas]] or the River Walk in [[San Antonio|Austin-San Antonio]], then feel free to explore them in the alternative future of [[The Texaplex]].

The world has changed a lot from the 1970s though and the Texaplex even more. In case you don't have a specific place in mind, choose a location based on what features it has. It could be as specific as on the shoreline of one of the nearly 7000 reservoirs in Texas, or in the converted meat packing plant, or even as simple as on a quite stretch of highway 105 or on the otherside of the wall from downtown.

Don’t worry about the current streets or infrastructure. Much of the surface may have been destroyed and rewritten.  Assume that it has, and that a uniform maze of square structures obscure the sky from street level. Write down your locale in a way that everyone agrees to focusing on it during play.






[[Block Generation|F: Block Generation]]: Step 3

CHROMODROME is a game intended for playing a cyberpunk game.
Cyberpunk as a genre has it's own tropes to support it's themes that makes it distinct from other futuristic, such as:

*A cynical view of the effects of technology on society.
*A future ruled my multi-national megacorporations.
*Both sides of most conflicts have equally justifiable missions and means.
*Sex and drug culture
*Protagonists that fight against being oppressed
*Loneliness and separation from humanity

Themes help make a story distinct. Through the use of themes, the group can develop a tonally consistent story. There are plenty of more themes in cyberpunk. to pull from. You can even mix in themes from other genres, like I have with some wild west themes.

There are plenty of other themes you could choose, such as:

* Quest for redemption.
* Skyscraper city.
* Is there peace in accomplishment?
* Police state.
* Heartbreak at betrayal.
* Does might make right?
* All people pay in blood.
* Is technology a divider?
* Evil is unsustainable.
* Getting the biggest baddest sword.
* Working class struggles.
* Is loneliness a destructive force?
* Everything is dramatic.
* Deals with the devil is a requirement.
* Is humanity just for humans?

Go over the table and discuss among yourselves which themes are most important or which ones people don't want to be brought up at the table. Once the table has a few major themes they want to explore, it time to move onto the next step.






That's this game you're reading about, numbskull. But if you are looking for a definition, [[here|Landing]] you go.






''Coercive'' is a measure of a character’s non-kosher social skills that focus on using others and getting what you want through negative social experiences.  Examples included include deception, intimidation, social engineering, spreading false rumors and gossip. Fast talkers and cheats both have high Coercive scores, as well might underhanded corporate rats.






Theres a lot going on in the Texaplex, jut=st like any megacity. Unlike other megacities, the Texaplex is a lot flatter than others like [[Bay City]] and  [[Megacity One]]. That means going on foot isn’t going to get you to your place like it would other places. Most people have to rely on mass transit systems like railways or buses and personal transportation. The typical fuel source for almost all transportation has advanced beyond the need of fossil fuels and is acquired either directly from the [[Grid Authority]], or through the use of hydrogen fuel, such as for cars, buses, and other automobiles.

!!Municipal Systems
Rapid transit or railways are used in within urban areas and and between cities to transport mass amounts of people over typically short distances with frequent, short stops. Some systems may only extend to the inner limits of a city, while others in larger areas extend into suburban areas. In the Texaplex, the rapid transit systems are usually above ground or as a superstructure,” unlike the megacities of the American Northeast. These rails, both private and public are governed by regional transit authorities, but a few, like DART (Dallas Area Rapid Transit) are self governing.

!!Texas Bullet
The ''Texas Bullet'' is a secured high-speed railway that operates on underground closed tracks that connects all of the major Texaplex areas, allowing for travel from any end of the Texaplex to the other in less than an hour. For its speed comes a hefty price, and its security is able to reject almost all forms of fraudulent [[SaIN ID|SaIN IDs]]. If you are able to make it, you can say farewell to any troubles left behind, except for those with the connects or resources on the other side. It currently has multiple stops in [[Dallas-Fort Worth]], [[Fort Hood]], [[Waco]], [[Austin-San Antonio]], [[Greater Houston]], and [[College Station]].

!!Private Transportation
For those who can afford or heavily rely on it, ''private transportation'' such as a personal motorbike or car allows a greater sense of freedom and privacy that other means of transportation. All commercial vehicles are designed to sync with the DriveNet, a system of roadways and computers that allow for autonomous driving through metropolitan areas and the interstate highways. Private transportation allows unrestricted movement within the Texaplex.

!!Ride Services
For short distances, a person can order or hail a self-driving taxi to pick them up. [[Otto's]] is the most popular service available today. They offer to transport you safely to your desired location. They offer packages and upgrade that will have them send a faster, better armored taxi with a heavier arsenal. A common alternative to Otto's is ZiggyRide, a an electric scooter and bike rental service. They offer no protection or privacy, but their lots and kiosks make they readily accessible and quick to rent.








Contacts serve as a means for acquiring information or access, sell illegal or illicit gear, and a way for asking and pulling favors. Each contact is limited in their area of expertise or business, but it is broad enough to allow a variety of uses, like a player character's foci. So  keep in mind that a weapons dealer isn't easily going to get you security codes, but may be able to help trace the sale history of a weapon.  While the player chooses what their contact's expertise is, the GM determines the scope and it's limits.

To acquire a contact, spend a number of SC as shown on the following table. A contact's ''Connection'' represents how effective a contact is at getting or doing what you need done. If a roll is required, it determines the starting number of dice for the Dice Pool. ''Loyalty'' is how much time they are willing to spend and how much pressure they are willing to take to get what you need done.  It also serves as the value to determine hits on any dice roll the contact makes.

!!!!Improving Contact Relations
To improve your Contact's Loyalty after character creation, spend SC equal to the sum of the new Loyalty and and new Connection scores. The New Loyalty and Connection must be adjacent (Just to the right or just below the previous score)s on the Contact table. To acquire new Contacts during or after play, the GM determines their starting connection and provides options based on the Loyalty most befitting that expressed during play. You spend the the Sc shown on the table below

| |!Connection |<|<|<|<|<|
|!Loyalty | | ''1'' | ''2'' | ''3'' | ''4'' | ''5'' |
|~| ''1'' | 1 | 2 | 3 | 5 | 9 |
|~| ''2'' | 2 | 3 | 4 |  6 | 9 |
|~| ''3'' | 3 | 4 | 5 | 7 | 10 |
|~| ''4'' | 5 | 6 | 7 | 9 | 12|
|~| ''5'' | 7 | 8 | 9 | 11 | 13 |
|~| ''6'' | 9 | 10 | 11 | 13 | 15 |
|~| ''7'' | 12 | 13 | 14 | 16 | 18 |
|~| ''8'' | 15 | 16 | 17 | 19 | 21 |
|~| ''9'' | 18 | 19 | 20 | 22 | 24 |
|~| ''10'' | 23 | 24 | 25 | 27 | 29 |







Sometimes characters will [[take actions|Taking Action]] directly opposed against other characters. The most common examples of this is noticing something hidden, quarantining a intrusion on [[The Net]], and attacking a person in combat. When such contests occur, the aggressor and the defender both roll, but the aggressor subtracts the defender's [[Hits]] from their number of Hits for the final number of Hits for their roll. In this way, the aggressor only needs to match the number of hits the defender gets to succeed.






''Cool'' is a measure of a character’s fashion ability, appeal and their ability to remain focused in face of danger or threat.  While it does not necessarily denote how physically attractive you are it does include a measure of a character’s social presence.  Example behaviors include trying to impress a person with a story, staying focused, and remaining calm. A charismatic character with the ability to draw others to themselves have high Cool scores.






''Coordination'' is a measure of a character’s nimble, quiet or tricky movement, resistance to falling, finesse, and other delicate bodily movements and control.  Examples include acts of gymnastics, safely sliding down a ramp, tumbling, keeping a steady hand, and sneaking up behind someone. Character good with pistols and light weapons as well as stealthy characters have high Coordination scores.






''Corporate Zones'' are semi-autonomous legal zones controlled by [[Megacorporations]] and include work areas and sometime shelter for their and their subsidiaries employees. They are typically kept clean, neat and orderly. The safety and retention of capital and assets demands a strong and observant security force. Movement in and out of the zone is scrutinized and monitored. Most corporate zones are in the city centers of all major cities, are well lit and virtually free of corporate crime. All [[Arcologies]] are corporate zones under the complete control of a sole megacorporation.

!!Executive Zones.
''Executive Zones'' are the corporate zones of corporate zones and only intended to receive and invite the executive level leadership and members of the boards of the greatest megacorporations, such as the [[Big 12]]. These typically serve as islands within a corporate zone and are each maintained by their respective megacorporation. They have the greatest security known on the street and have access to nearby rapid threat response teams to neutralize any existential threats and intrusions. [[Jobbers|Jobber]] who pull jobs in Executive Zones are the best equipped, and become street legends whether they snuff it or not.

!!Multi-Corporate Zones
These zones are comprised of small corporations that band together to create safe zones for work. They are not as well equipped or maintained as corporate zones since they have an absence of a backing megacorporation. They typically are contained in [[Fuller Domes]] to provide some protection from [[The Dust]], and are called dome cities since more street level businesses operation and may also house a black market run by a [[ShadowBiz|ShadowBizs]].






''Corpos'' is the style of the mass produced and cultural fashion scene which derives its name from the corporations that supply it to consumers and demand it from its workers. Also called designer fashion or suburbia fashion, this style’s clothing focuses on the simpler, traditional and “timeless” fashion of the city, middle class and those that benefit from the system. Everything is sleek, clean, and fashionable.  Those that adhere to the Corpos style focus on maintaining a clean and pure image to their neighbors and strangers alike and are comforted in knowing that every other Corpo is doing their best to look their best.

Protecting one’s image and //personal brand// is important, and the clean refined style choices that Corpos provides are an easy image to maintain. This proper fashion is often manufactured using current and modern fabrication techniques and is the most popular. While simple, is also has the greatest appeal and variety when it comes to type and variety of gear, especially in terms of their price point. Corpos style has also provided many branded opportunities and has a large consumer base for the person that buys into the cookie cutter, but also pristine image that is Corpos.







!!Sculpt job

Don't like your face, get a better one! Shave that nose, add a horn to your forehead, change the color and texture of your hair, eyes, and skin. the most basic of sculpt jobs simply change your appearance. Burned jobbers or jobbers doing deep work use them to assume another physical identity. Some take more drastic sculpt work to change their vocal cords, lengthen bone or change their bone structure to bio metric scanners. The most invasive and dangerous bio sculpts deal with assuming the physical identity of another person as replicants. In the trade, a jobber or corporate asset replaces a target for power or access, but a few [[BlkStims|SimStims]] addicts undergo sculpt jobs to assume the identity of famous celebrities or pop-culture figures.

''Scult Jobs '' costs depending on the nature and invasiveness of the change. If you're looking to perfectly replicate  a person's appearance, expect a high SC cost, but simple plastic surgery or changes in color or texture of features are far cheaper.

|!Detail |!SC Cost |!Examples |
|Simple |2 each |Eye, skin, and hair color, skin and hair replacement, tattoo removal, nasal shape, eye shape, scar removal, fillers, peels, vein removal, ear shape, botox |
|Moderate |4 each |Changes in height and frame, breast augmentation, nose job, facial lifts, augmentation, abdominal reshaping, fat reduction/reshaping |
|Master |6 each |Breast reconstruction, facial reconstruction, muscular reconstruction, vocal reconstruction |
|Nano |8 each |Biometric mimicry, replicating |

!!Tattoos

The clinical sort would describe tattoos as a form of body mod where designs are created by the insertion of ink, pigments or dyes into the skin layer to change it's color. But it's more than that. It's a means of identification that can't be ripped from you. For some, tattoos are just a style choice. a way to rebel and be edgy. For other's it ties families together, helps crews and shadowbizs identity who's in or who's out. Back in the Politcal World War era, tattoos were used by armed service men and navys to identify and catalog the tours and ships you served on. Slavers used to tattoo who slaves where, Oceanic Islanders used tattoos to sell personal stories. 

Today, nearly everyone has a tattoo. A Corp won't call it that, they'll call it something flat like a "Dermal ID," but it's still ink (UV or AR activated ink) in the skin. With the collapse of state penitentiaries, or the inability of rural municipalities or suburban conclaves to care for prisoners, forced tattoos have come back. Someone is violent, has mental damage, partakes in armed robbery or grand theft auto? You'll see it written on their faces, their arms, their chests like brands to misbehaving cattle. They aren't elegant, or filled with symbolism like traditional shadowBiz tattoos. They are explicit, ugly, and poorly done.

Tattoos cover an area no larger than roughly 9% of the human skin's total surface area. 9% skin area is equivalent to the head and neck, each arm, the upper chest, the stomach/abdomen, the upper back/shoulders, the lower back, and the front or back of each leg, with a incidental 1% taking the area of the groin. The groin can be included with the 9% of an adjacent area of skin at no additional cost.

!!!Detail
Not all tattoo are the same in subject matter, and most of them are of varying quality and done by tattoos artists of varying talent. Some tattoo designs are simple repeated and well practiced tattoos. They may contain a blown out line or a shaky line. the anatomy may be off or poorly designed, and the shading typically non-existent. Moderately detailed tattoos has better shading and have a respectable life-time before they need to be retouched or maintained. these designed can contain some difficult shading, a few complex details, but not all of them. Tattoo masters are able to provide the best tattoos done by the human hand and eye. they posses creative and impressive details and designs. oftentimes these tattoos are photo-realistic, detailed portraits, and contain barely any mistakes. Nano-tattoos are high-end tattoos complete by computer controlled equipment, able to make movements the natural human hand is incapable and able to produce exact replication of tattoos and images on the human skin. While better tattoos typically cost more, just because a tattooist charges a lot, doesn't ensure that you'll come out with a worth-it piece.

!!!Color

!!!Smart Ink
''Smart Ink'' are tattoos that are interactive or programmable with the use of a comm. They can be animated tattoos, such as a snake travelling around a limb eating it's own tail, a bird that flaps it's wings, or a tattoo that shifts from being visible only in the UV spectrum to being visible to the naked light on command. the cost of such tattoos are 3 times the cost of it's traditional counterpart.

|~|Simple|Moderate|Master|Nano|
|!Coloring|Black/White|2|4|6|8|
|~|+1 Coloring|4|6|8|10|
|~|+2 Coloring|-|8|10|12|
|~|+3 Coloring|-|-|12|14|

!!Cosmetic Gear
