During play you will want your character to do things, interact with people, move to different locations, use objects, and discover and explore new things.  Everything that your character can do is called an ''action'', of which there are three types:  [[Complex, Quick, and Reflexive.|Action Types]] Further detail will be provided later. To complete an action simply narrate or say what it is that your character does or attempts to do.  It is up to your GM to determine if such an action requires a roll.  After the effects of your action are determined, it is then time to complete another action.

* [[Action Types]]
* [[Turns]]
* [[Initiative]]






During your game, your character may easily come into harm’s way as they navigate tricky street jobs and corporate interests.  When your character ''takes damage'' and the damage is not reduced to zero, your character takes Harm equal to the remaining damage.  While a character's Harm is greater than zero, they become unable to takiactions as they fall unconscious, are dying, are quarantined in Cyberspace/the Net, or otherwise removed. The consequences of taking harm is determined by source and type, it’s severity and as the situation otherwise demands. 

!!Reducing Harm
Reducing Harm is possible through the actions of another character or specialized [[gear|Gear Catalog]]. For characters seeking to reduce harm, they would need to take a Complex Action and roll [[Smarts]]. Each successful ''Hit'' on the roll reduces the Harm by 3. It will often take multiple dice rolls to reduce all the harm to zero. The most common foci to use is [[Computers|Foci]] or [[Trauma|Foci]], but usually whatever is most appropriate. Once Harm is reduced to zero, the character is in a state in which they can once more begin [[Taking Action]]. 

!!Dying
Harm can either be lethal or non-lethal. If the amount of lethal Harm that a character has is greater than 5 times the character's [[Hearty]] score, they die. The effects of gear or the source of the damage will indicate whether something is non-lethal. If it doesn't, it is assumed it is lethal.

Should a character or target suffer both lethal and non-lethal damage, the non-lethal damage should be resolved first, before then resolving the effects of the lethal damage.

!!Types of Damage
There is a seemingly infinite type of damage you can take from road burn to taking high energy radiation to a simple bullet to the face. The following 7 types are the most common: ''Cutting'', ''Crushing'', ''Puncturing'', ''Ballistic'', ''Neural'', ''Toxic'', and ''Radiation''.









<<<
"No mater how predicatble, a drone or computer will always be more predictable that humans. Humans don't always do what there told. Drone are more comfortable to talk to for some wireheads because of that"
<<<

```
//Techies, Riggers, Mechs, wrenchers, grease monkeys, boards, Wire-heads, drone-jockey, texpert, sysers, gear head, machinist, Cyberman//
```

Characters belonging to this archetype are the rogue mechanic, street doc, or technical experts of the street.  They can either find or make what you need for your job. All for a fee of course. They are the best in their fields, and jacks at all the rest at either fixing you or what you need.  While not the best in the gun fight, a Teked can either maintain the equipment that can circumvent such engagements, or make such encounters one-sided.

!!![[Abilities]] and [[Foci]]
Choose one ability array from below:

| 3 | !Athletics | 3 |
| 3 | !Charm | 3 |
| 3 | !Coersive | 2 |
| 4 | !Cool | 4 |
| 4 | !Coordination | 4 |
| 4 | !Empathy | 4 |
| 2 | !Hearty | 3 |
| 4 | !Luck | 5 |
| 5 | !Smarts | 5 |
| 5 | ! Perception | 4 |

Choose one array from below for the ranking of your character's foci:

| Computers| !Expert | Repair |
| Repair |~| Trauma |
| Books | !Moderate | Books|
| Interface |~| Drive |
| Killswitch |~| Finagle |
| Netrunning|~| Interface |
| Wipe|~| Killswitch |
| Finagle | !Basic | Computer |
| Security |~| Security |
| Trauma|~| Stunts |

!!!Typical Equipment
*Diagnostic Scanner
*Investigation tools
*trauma gear
*Repair tools
*Drone rig
*Drone Controller
*Van or Truck
*Machining gear
*Data Vaults
*Manipulators

[[Exploits]]

!!!!Additional Cyberware
Your maximum renegade score and renegade score for are both increased by 15.

!!!!Machine Whisperer
You have strong edge  when communicating with Robots and Artificial Intelligences.

!!!!Tech Market
Select a specialty of technology or gear when you chose this exploit. You are able to buy and sell items of that type at a 10% benefit to you.

!!!!Dual Rigged
Spend 3 style at the start of your turn and you can control two rigs/drones in the same round. However, you will still need to take separate actions to command each rig/drone on your turn.

!!!!Integrated Interface
Select one very specific type of rig, vehicle or system. You do not need to roll to interface with with gear or objects of that type.

!!!!My Baby!
Choose one rig, system, or gear when you selected this item. You repair an additional 2 wear per success on rolls to repair the selected rig, system, or gear.

!!!!This is Junk
Spend 10 style to create a single use consumable piece of tech out of the junk around you as a complex action. The gear must be simple in use and composition.

!!!!Tech-eye
Select a specialty of technology or gear when you choose this exploit. You roll edge of appraising or repairing the chosen specialty.






Once in power, a governor has two major options, become a glorified corporate spokesperson or becoming vilified in corporate media and be a one term governor. The only other one is a magic trick involving placing a bullet in your head while going down Elm Street.






Whenever the result of an [[action|Action Types]] is not clear, or there is a chance for success or failure which could alter the narrative of the game, or because a game rule or mechanic says to roll, a pool of dice is rolled to help determine the outcome.

The dice pool is a collection of 10-sided dice who’s size is based on your character’s [[abilities|Abilities]], situation and/or chosen [[Exploits]]. The larger the number of dice in your dice pool, the greater the chances of success.  If you do not have 10-sided dice available, 6-sided can be used with some adjustments to the rules of the game.  10-sided dice are special polyhedral dice that can be bought on-line or at a local gaming or hobbyist store.  They may be numbered 1-10 or 0-9.  If a dice top facing side shows a 0, treat it as it the dice rolled a 10 instead.  Some 10-sided dice show the similar values by a factor of 10, i.e, 00, 10, 20, …, 90, 100.  If you use these dice, treat 00 as if it showed 100 instead.

The chances that a die is considered a success is dependent upon the training a character has in an appropriate [[focus|Foci]]. The higher the training in a focus, the greater the chances of success when using that focus.







//No one// knows where ''the dust'' came from, and the corps have been unable to verify it’s cause, but one thing is for certain. Someone’s lying about something.

The dust is one of the worst things to happen to someone. The poor or people too unfortunate to get stuck in a dust storm end up developing [[Dust Toxicity Syndrome]] (DTS). It’s a nasty way to go. Reports talk about how it can do everything from killing your brain cells, causing your muscles to atrophy, causing infertility, making your lungs bleed and causing all sorts of cancers and new diseases. The dust messes with your genetics, meaning any of your future kids inherit all the damage as well. Those too affected are forced to register with the state and corporation and sometimes undergo forced sterilization.

To combat the dust, many of the wealthier cities have already moved into or built geodesic domes. Blocks and other megastructures have close atmospheric systems to keep the dust out. Going and living outside of these life saving environments requires respirators and masks to keep you safe. The public safety boards have said no respirators are required as long as your indoors, but all the largest corporations enclose themselves in the domes. It’s assumed that all persons have a respirator besides the poorest of the poor, but that might just be you. In that case, it might just be worth selling yourself to a corp as a wage slave if it means cleaner air.

The Dust is monitored and reported via public net nodes by the [[Weather and Air Monitoring Authority]], or ''WAMA'' for short.







''The Glitz'' is short for //Glittzerante// which originates from the early 21st culture, popular Net-based culture and promotional channels.  The style is product of a youth culture of that time but is also a product in of itself. Firstly, as being the top and trending material and the first to cover a cultural subject or news bit. Secondly, to sell a personality of the Glitz as a product to be enjoyed by the viewer themselves.  

Clothing is often conventional, youthful but with a twist that takes it away from the Corpo style.  It breaks the rules without breaking too many rules. The clothing and gear are built around fun, and a presenting a fantastical image or version of the Glitz’ life.  Everything is intended to bring and focus attention to the chosen subject while not alienating the audience. 

Gear is often social and media savvy in function, capturing the lives and information of the Glitz and their environment.  A person ought to assume that they're being recorded if a Glitz is near them. Audio and visual capture is used in the creation of and promotion of a fashionable, trendy life style or beauty standard.







People in the Texaplex live in different and overlapping worlds: The real, the augmented, the virtual, and the Net, are some of these. Each one gives access to various experiences, can operate on its own rules and has their own limitations. The everyday citizen operates in most of these “spaces” every day. Most have at least experienced events in all of them.

!!The Real

The natural world in which we are all born into, of flesh and blood. This original space is often referred to as the real world, or derogatorily as “meat-space.”  It is the space in which people intuitively understand the concepts of space and time, and which virtual space and virtual realities were made in the image of. For the denizens of the Net, the Real is where the space where all the nodes, comms, servers and hosts are and where their "meat" stays. 

Accessing digital information from the Net in the Real is done through the use of comms or node, where digital information is rendered as images and text and on a flat screen and information is handled through physical methods such as keyboards and or touch screens.

!!Augmented Reality

Augmented reality, or ''AR'', overlays digital information and communications from Personal Area Networks and NearMe broadcasts with the sensory stimulation of everyday life. This information once within short range appear displayed on some surface or layer of glass such as glasses, motor bike helmets or through cybernetic eyes. A boutique shows ghostly images of people moving and wearing the clothes they sell, a restaurant projects the menu into the field of vision of AR enabled patrons and they select what they want via hand gestures or thought. AR allows Crime Investigators to project models of security footage over the real world location. 

AR also allows for specialized access and communications via the net without having to need full access to the Net. Weather updates, the time of day, the current score for baseball game, and reminders and to do lists can all be saved and monitored by a Comms device that pushes the information to your field of vision via AR.

!![[The Net]]

''The Net'' is the hierarchical global system of interconnected nodes and digital devices that use protocols to communicate digital information. This information can be pushed to a comm or rendered in AR, but the two major means of interacting with data occurs in [[Virtual Reality]] using [[SimStim technology|SimStims]] or by a direct neural to the Net in [[Cyberspace]]. Each allows for the manipulation and teath of data in non-real space, but each has different 

[[Virtual Reality]] -  A computer generated reality that is run on a host and simulates a reality where digital information and programs are  represented as audio visual stimuli. Users become immersed in the world via use of a computer deck and interact with VR through use of a computer program called an avatar.

[[The Net]] -  The hierarchical global system of interconnected nodes and digital devices that use protocols to communicate digital information. The Net is commonly rendered by computers in VR, but a few people directly interact with the net by integrating their entire consciences via neural links. Those people are said to be operating in the Net in [[Cyberspace]]

!!Coexisting
A woman walks down the street and sees a holographic advertisement appear on their AR PAN. A cowboy chooses not to fully integrate into Cyberspace but have terminals able to render a VR imitation. A wage slave completes a 12-hour shift in 7 hours while in VR. Meanwhile their body rests safely in their cubical bed, watched over by building security.

Life quickly moves between these various layers, and experiences follow a person blending the edges between what is real and what has consequences. Why should you walk up to a store counter when you can easily jack-in and order your meal via AR or VR while you continue walking to pick it up in real space. Think about what comes naturally to your character based on the access they’ve had to the various worlds, especially the access they had when middle school aged. This’ll inform you on how inclined they are to experiences in different spaces.







Short for the World-Wide Information Network, ''the Net'' is a hierarchical global system of interconnected nodes and digital devices that use specialized protocols to communicate digital information. It is a network of private, public, academic, business, and local networks organized by scope based on registration, privileges and geography, therefore limiting movement and communication in the Net up and down the network chain and not between the otherwise disconnected regional or personal area networks.

|!Abbreviation |!Name |!Example |
|GEH |''G''lobal ''E''xchange ''N''etwork | A digital hub that manages user access from one WAN to another, creating the global net. |
|WAN |''W''ide ''A''rea Network |Texaplex, Atlantic Sprawl |
|MAN |''M''etropolitan ''A''rea ''N''etwork |Dallas Fort Worth, Houston, Texia |
|~IExH |''I''nformation ''Ex''change ''N''etwork |A digital hub that manages users access from one RAN to another in the same MAN |
|RAN |''R''egional ''A''rea ''N''etwork |The network for and maintained by a geographical zone or suburban municipality, such such as |
|CAN |''C''ampus ''A''rea ''N''etwork |The network of interconnected buildings or block. |
|LAN |''L''ocal ''A''rea ''N''etwork |The network in a single home or office. |
|PAN |''P''ersonal ''A''rea ''N''etwork |A comm or terminal and all devices, cyberware or gear linked to it. |

!!Accessing the Net
Accessing the Net requires the use of a PAN enabled device connected to a Net node. Net nodes are commonly in modern constructions, and most buildings have been retrofitted. Net access starts at the PAN level and involves gaining access to higher systems (LANs, CANs) by located specialized nodes that connect the various hierarchies of the Net. For a more interactive experience, The Net is interacted with in [[VR|Virtual Reality]] or [[Cyberspace]]. For players, this may be the more common means of [[Using the Net]].

!!Hazards on the Net
With so much data on the Net, agent work to protect it through the use of Intrusive Counter measures or ''IC'' pronounced "Ice." IC can be either programs but also sometimes hardware features designed to hamper illicit activity on the Net. Common examples are [[Firewalls]] that block access of data to unauthorized users, [[Keys]] which grant specialized access to data or programs from within a system, and [[Yellow Jackets]] that patrol systems to locate and defeat intrusions.

!!Being Ejected from the Net
Some time during play, a character will trip a system alarm or lose in cybercombat while in the net. One of the effects that can occur is the forced ejection from the Net. The effects of being ejected form the net different between whether you where in VR or in Cyberspace, but are all usually negative or of some cost. The most common way for a person to be ejected from the net is either doing a forced eject yourself or taking harm.

!![[ShadowNets]]
Some parts of the Net are not hosted by corporations. They are built and maintained by ShadowBizs and fixers who find jobs for deniable assets such as your characters, should they have the connections. They don't use the usual protocols, have low profiles in Cyberspace, highly active IC and security, and typically require [[Street Cred]] just to be given guest access. Most runners don't have access, but high profile fixers do.






''The Ones'' style groups form their members from all social classes and does not adhered to any social, economic, political or technological truths and haves a style dedicated to the appearance of cool. Their major style points are adopted from or, more accurately, ripped off   from turn of the millennium period of futuristic cinema.

What they fight for is the cool, a strange approach to exhibiting an idealized version of themselves.  Their clothing and gear are often industrial or synthetic in nature, and their gear focuses on enhancing ones own physical and mental abilities to achieve a more glory filled existence.

Their appearance is often inexpressive and intense, their clothing is dark, shiny, and their hair looks like they just walked out of a place where everything is wet.  The social groups that adopt a The One mentality are often formed remotely over the net, and - as such - their language and communications often adopt a fetishized amount of short hand as typically used in the Net.







As a ''Player'', you create and have authority over the actions of a single character in the game called a Player character or ''PC''. Your PC is one of the major focal points of the your game, along with all the other players in the character. 

As a PC in [[CHROMODROME]], your character exists in the cracks of an oppressive society ruled by megacorporations, multinational corporations that have the power of superpower countries, like the former United States of America. your character has skills, abilities and know the right people to more than just survive. You take a street name to help hide your true identity, or maybe you steel a dead person's. While you pull jobs for criminal [[ShadowBizs]]  and the very [[Megacorporations]] threw you out or never even thought to let you in.

Your PC, which may be referred to as a [[Jobber]] on the streets of [[The Texaplex]], is one of a small cast of main characters most likely to survive to become key players in your cyberpunk saga. You decide what actions your PC takes, what they say, and how they improve and get better.  You make these decisions based on their concept or backstory, and as the narrative demands.  When you play, you [[take actions|Taking Action]] responding to the [[GM|Being a Game Master]] as if you were in your character’s shoes.







Global economic disaster soon came home to roost, bringing with it its own horsemen of the apocalypse. The governments of the world could no longer cut their budgets to spurn more economic growth after too many  decades of starving themselves.  As social programs, education, and military spending declined, corporate friendly and corporate bought politicians began paying the corporations to take care of the general populace and the public good.

But as the western economy lagged and fell behind, the corporations themselves slumped into economic crisis.  Today, international and inter planetary corporations manage and control so much of everyone’s lives.  Those unable to produce a return of profit for the corporations or did not conform were abandoned by the system, dropped into the cracks of society.  Some of those that landed outside the system soon found their own way on the streets.  Those capable but disposable to the corporations and organized criminal organizations would become deniable assets and possibly runners.

You play characters that fight to survive in the cracks and are living the edge.  You use whatever tech you can to survive and get paid for a job done, even jobs for the same corporations that threw you out.  You thrive during the 20 minutes past the dark future of the 90s, where you make shady deals and accomplish tasks with your own flair and for your own reasons.






The world was supposed to be different.  People had a vision of what life would be like today that was different than actuality. Information and Data, and the technology that supported it, was supposed to bring upon a new and exciting world.  Disease should have been eliminated, poverty eradicated, and countries would cease having war.  The sleek flying chrome cars of the future never came, in a way never expected.  

The rise of the megacorporations during the mutation of American brand conservatism, while boosting the world economies, also made enemies as the hands of the western would battle for resources among themselves and across Asia and the Pacific.  As countries fiscally starved themselves on the promise of greater amounts of cash into the future, the Corporations grew and cannibalized themselves, becoming superpowers on their own right. On the way, the megacorps decided to no longer play by the rules or decided to change the rules in the interest of generating the greatest financial returns for their investors.  But, by then, the people became all to unaware, distracted by the chrome and neon their parents where promised.

Humanity became consumed with itself.  Tools became consumable, trees became plastic, and people became resources.  Humans and machine could interface in a way never done before.  Humanity now navigates the world virtually by jumping in the Net, leaving the body behind in the meat space while they lived in the virtual reality. When their body failed, broke, or wasn’t up to task, a person could fuse machines and computers to their own flesh, to run faster, think quicker, and to look better.  Then humanity made the jump to the stars – colonies, satellites and space stations twinkled in the night sky.  







The people and the machines of the world lurk between the tall block towers of [[Megacities]]. These megacities are filled with neon, chrome and scarcity for the vulnerable. The ''Texaplex'' is an urban sprawl in the [[State of Texas]] of the [[Former United States of America]]. It is composed of varied cultures and races geographically bound by Interstates highways I-35, I-45, and I-10. Megacorporations that span not just the earth, but also the solar system dominate the markets and politics of the Texaplex by sheer numbers and capital. 95% percent of the population of Texas lives within the Texaplex, while 80% live within the Metropolitan areas of [[Austin and San Antonio|Austin-San Antonio]], [[Houston|Greater Houston]], and the [[Dallas-Fort Worth Metroplex|Dallas-Fort Worth]].

The Texaplex is often used synonymous with the State of Texas, but is often just refers to the sprawl and rounds that connect the States largest metropolises.

!Politics
!!Law and Order
During the dissolution of most the the United States, many states legally dissolved or became consolidated inside other states. the States of Texas acquire many tracks of land and populaces The Republic of Texas once claimed which includes former Wyoming, Colorado, Kansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico east of the Rio Grande, and American Indian Lands. With these claims, Texas claims the cities of [[Albuquerque]], [[Dodge City]], [[Pueblo]] and [[Santa Fe]].

!!!State Government
At the top of the government in the Texaplex is the State government with its 3 branches of government. However, the officials are elected from a barely active voter base with only 8% of the population voting. Some accuse the state of policies that design such a selective and inactive voting population. Of the three branches, the Executive branch is the only one with any real power, as the [[Texas Governor]] has the power to mobilize the [[Texas National Guard]] and [[Texas Rangers]]. But even then the Executive branch is a plural executive with many powers divested among the Lieutenant Governor, the Railroad Commissioner, and others. 

There is some money to be made in politics, particularly within the Legislature since corporations will pay you to not do anything while you gain all the benefits of being in office. Even if a true reformer gets elected to office against the odds, the corporations and wealthy individuals will run the Texaplex as they see fit. So even if there was a candidate that says all the right things and is squeaky clean, they’ll be one against hundreds, so unless you have more than everyone else, you are not going to be happy with whatever candidate gets elect.

!!!Metroplex Governments
The Texaplex, being entirely contained within it's claimed borders, is subject to all its laws. The four major metroplexs and various Interior Governments compose the secondary level of public governance. While slightly different in form, each is headed by a plural board of executive and judicial panels composed of corporate or corporate controlled representatives. Each representative heads and overseas special zones, typically empowered based on the business or wealth of the residence with their jurisdictions. Some [[Blocks]] and [[Arcologies]] may be so large they they may qualify as their own special zone and have a council with an administrator that handles all day-to-day business.

!!!Municipal Governments
Very few municipal governments continue to exist. Those that do typically dot the highway system between the metroplexes or lands that has become unincorporated and fall under the jurisdiction of the Railroad Commissioner. The de facto public leader of these small governments are sheriffs, which are publicly elected. These governments barely function, and a sheriffs job is to mostly keep outsiders out. The only other concern is ensuring that the towns and cities remain as long as possible on the map. This is particularly difficult for the towns to the north and west as [[The Dust]] continues to blow closer to the Texaplex.


!! State Law Enforcement
!!!Texas Rangers
Officially referred to as the ''Texas Ranger Division of the Department of Safety'', the Texas Rangers is a state-wide investigative and military agency with statewide jurisdiction in Texas, and based in the capital city of Austin. In history it served as a state-wide police force and protective force during the wild west, but today serves as a border security, investigative agency, special protections, and military force of armed combatants.

Today, they mostly deal with crimes that cross Metroplex and Interior Governments borders. This includes cybercrime, trafficking of contraband drugs and people, and political crimes.

!!!Lawbringers
The result of specialized cybernetic and military technology, a ''Lawbringer'' is designed to fulfill the famous Texas Ranger line, "one riot, one ranger." Lawbringers is legal empowered to serve as a mobile police, judicial, and military agent. They have broad sweeping authority to uphold the laws of the State of Texas, including the authority to act as judge, jury, and executioner in criminal and civil cases.

Their cyberware grants these walking tanks access to ROM psyche-decks of the best judges, lawyers, police and military forces.  It allows the Lawbringer to process legal procedures at the site or occurrence of a crime, and execute acts of force in the most expedient manner. While many civil groups and political clubs have come out against Lawbringers since their introduction in 2038, no action has been taken by the courts. This has allowed these walking tanks to both shoot with lethal force and fine persons for public indecency.

!!Local Law Enforcement
Most day-to-day, on the street law enforcement occurs throught the use of private police forces. This came to be following wide spread protests by police  and correction officer unions, and private corporations undercutting their public competition into non-existence. Today, a person is most likely to come across a officer from [Peace Inc]] or [[Sighard Security]] than any other, and their is only one publicly prison.

!!Texas National Guard
The ''Texas National Guard'' serves as an active reserve military force that mostly provides border security, emergency relief, and oversight of contracted Private Military corporations such as [[Interior Intelligence Solutions]].

!Texaplex Geography
!![[Austin-San Antonio]]
This metroplex composes the south-western most point of the Texaplex. and serves as the capital of the State of Texas as well as the music and SimStims capitals as well. It's land is predominantly hilly, and boasts a large Hispanic and mobile culture of cars and moving suburbias.

!![[Dallas-Forth Worth]]
Commonly refereed to as "The Metroplex" by it's denizens, its high population density leaves it as cultural and financial hub. It forms the northern point of the Texaplex and it's most northern suburban city of Denton serves as one of it's busiest interstate point of entries.

!![[Greater Houston]]
While the Greater Houston area is sometime referred to as a Metroplex, it's only truly composed of the City of Houston , Texas's largest city, and a few suburban areas. It serves as the cheif international point of entry and is home to a chaotic mix of refugee cultures and energy corporations. the entireity of the Greater Houston areas is within a flood plane and extends through Galveston into the Gulf of Mexico.

!!The Green Corridor
In the center of the Texaplex is the ''Green Corridor'', built along the Brazos River and hubed in College Station. The Green Corridor serves a greenhouse where many corporations and colleges research genetically engineered crops and livestock for mass food consumption.  Many college and [[Megacorporation's|Megacorporations]] own research labs in the area.

The central location and the sealed geodesic domes  allows for year round simulation of weather conditions across the Texaplex. This allows controlled production of crops and expensive experimental flora that can only be found in specific biomes not naturally found Texas,. Additionally, the green corridor is a state protected space, meaning only citizens with certain [[SaIN IDs]] get to go. Instead the rich and Megacorporationists get to enjoy the commons without having to worry about the inherent tragedy of them.  Instead jobbers like us stay out, while they get to reinvent themselves away from home.

!![[Independent City of Texia]]
This small but powerful independent city is contained within the ''Dallas-Fort Worth.'' Referred to as ''Texia'' for short, this city is situated on the western shores of White Rock Lake and it's wealthy megacorporationist citizens have recreated their own North Atlantic city filled with gardens and glass.

!![[Corporate Zones]]
These zones are scattered through out the State of Texas. They serve as private property where a megacorporation has sovereignty within their Zone. Some Mega corporations band together to form corporate zones together, while large enough megacorporations are able to construct [[Arcologies]] for their employee's to live, work, and have families. The most Famous Arcology is the [[Texas Instruments Arcology]] in the DFW area.

!!Dustlands
''Dustlands'' are areas of the central former United States when [[The Dust]] challenges the survival of its residents.  It noted by it's severe dust storms, unrecoverable ecology, and drought conditions. these conditions are mostly situated to the North western slant of the Texaplex. Virtually no-one lives in the dustlands except for the most extreme of [[Guzzlers]].  Those that do live there often succumb to the poisonous effects of the dust, and travelling through requires the use of protective gear such as respirators and full body and face covering. Most of the lands former inhabitants came to the texaplex and other megacities as refugees. 

!!Dusturbia
The Dust pushed many people out of the classic american dream of owning a home in the suburbs with a white picket fence. However, some of these suburban towns and cities still have a small local presence of hold outs. Most have already left for the Metroplexes, other countries, or even as space colonists. the mostly abandoned suburbs are known as ''dusturbias.'' A few large ShadowBizs have set up bases in these areas as a means of being outside the law of the Metroplexes and as safe havens. A few corporations operate safe travel centers. Most notable in the Texaplex is Buc-ee's bubble cities. Wayfarers can refuel, shower, shop and stay the night in Buc-ee's shopping areas and coffin hotels.

!Living in the Texaplex


!!Commuting in the Texaplex
DriveNet

The Texas Bullet

Spinners

Transit Systems

!!Education in the Texaplex
!!Communicating in the Texaplex
!!Everyday Tech in the Texaplex

!!Entertainment in the Texaplex









<<<
When shit hits the fan, just be glad you had a fan
<<<

!!The Power of the Machine
{{The Power of the Machine}}


!!The Point of No Return
{{The Point of No Return}}







''1976'' – Gerald Ford and Rob Dole are elected as President and Vice President of the United States of America.

''1986 ''– Boeing-Reeves Corporations wins the second space race and creates the first self-sustaining extra-terrestrial habitats for indefinite human use on Mars.

''1991 ''– the Kettle Falls riots occur in response to passage of legislation sponsored by the Freedom Business Bureau in both the USA and Canada.

''1998 ''– The [[Nova Kredit|Nova Kredits]] becomes first digitally recorded, nearly instantaneous means of transactions across the globe.

''2004 ''– The first Hypercorporation is formed when Japanese Metals and Manufacturing conglomerate merges with multiple aeronautics and electronic firms forming the [[Gaius-Masuda Corporation]].

''2007 ''– [[Philo Corporation]] completes an advanced neural mapping of the human brain and creates the first brain-computer user interfaces.

''2011 ''– Slowing global war reduces defense spending and manufacturing, exasperating a declining economy and thin housing market. Militarized police forces become the normal response to riots and civil protests alike.

''2013 ''– [[The Freedom Amendments]] are passed allowing corporations to act in self defense as a person and with multiple freedoms of expression, among others. Hypercorporations and some individuals are allowed the ability to act with sovereignty as a foreign state with all appropriate immunities and protections.

''2016 ''– The first human consciousness was integrated into and autonomously controlled a [[Hub Dynamics]], Glouster robot in their labs.

''2019 ''– Rutger Lesan performs their first pediatric neural surgery after receiving the first cybernetic arms designed by his company, [[Lesan Neural Abilities]].

''2025 ''– The first cyberbrains are created in [[Hosanna Labs]]. The first unexplained [[Limited Nuclear Exchange Phenomena]] (LNEP) occurs as nuclear warheads explode post- and pre-launch from their silos.

''Dec. 2029'' - [[The Net Crash]] causes globe rolling blackouts and LNEPs at the stroke of midnight on New Years. First case of death by neural bio-feedback while on the Net is recorded.

''2030'' – [[The Global Depression]] occurs causing economic ruin across the globe and solar system. Borders reform as world powers and corporations purchase insolvent countries.

''2032'' – The [[Net 2.0|The Net]] is created as a hierarchical structure in order to prevent the [[Net Crash]] from reoccurring. Some parts of Net 1.0 are rumored to exists isolated.

''2033'' – The USSR collapses and its assets and some former socialist block states would be privatized by the [[Russian Imperial Corporation]]. 

''2037'' – The first reported case of [[Dust Toxicity Syndrome]] is confirmed in the Journal of International Medicine.

''2041'' – Today






Everyone takes their [[actions|Action Types]] in ''turns''.  Most of the time, the turn order does not matter, and neither does how long a turn takes.  Everyone takes turns taking actions until everyone has either taken or have skipped their turn. Once that has happened, the current round ends, and everyone can take their new turns taking actions on the new round. Players should all be aware that while turns are explained in succession while playing the game, they may all occur at the same time in the game’s narrative.

Sometimes the turn order does matter, such as when there is an immediate threat, a tense negotiation, timing is important, during a chase through the streets or during combat. When the turn order matters, all players should roll dice to determine the order at which turns will be taken. This is called rolling for [[Initiative]].







data:image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAlgAAAFyCAYAAAApuaQRAAASYElEQVR4Xu3WsQ0AMAzDsPb/o12gN2hkDvBAZNDdtuMIECBAgAABAgQygSuwMktDBAgQIECAAIEvILA8AgECBAgQIEAgFhBYMag5AgQIECBAgIDA8gMECBAgQIAAgVhAYMWg5ggQIECAAAECAssPECBAgAABAgRiAYEVg5ojQIAAAQIECAgsP0CAAAECBAgQiAUEVgxqjgABAgQIECAgsPwAAQIECBAgQCAWEFgxqDkCBAgQIECAgMDyAwQIECBAgACBWEBgxaDmCBAgQIAAAQICyw8QIECAAAECBGIBgRWDmiNAgAABAgQICCw/QIAAAQIECBCIBQRWDGqOAAECBAgQICCw/AABAgQIECBAIBYQWDGoOQIECBAgQICAwPIDBAgQIECAAIFYQGDFoOYIECBAgAABAgLLDxAgQIAAAQIEYgGBFYOaI0CAAAECBAgILD9AgAABAgQIEIgFBFYMao4AAQIECBAgILD8AAECBAgQIEAgFhBYMag5AgQIECBAgIDA8gMECBAgQIAAgVhAYMWg5ggQIECAAAECAssPECBAgAABAgRiAYEVg5ojQIAAAQIECAgsP0CAAAECBAgQiAUEVgxqjgABAgQIECAgsPwAAQIECBAgQCAWEFgxqDkCBAgQIECAgMDyAwQIECBAgACBWEBgxaDmCBAgQIAAAQICyw8QIECAAAECBGIBgRWDmiNAgAABAgQICCw/QIAAAQIECBCIBQRWDGqOAAECBAgQICCw/AABAgQIECBAIBYQWDGoOQIECBAgQICAwPIDBAgQIECAAIFYQGDFoOYIECBAgAABAgLLDxAgQIAAAQIEYgGBFYOaI0CAAAECBAgILD9AgAABAgQIEIgFBFYMao4AAQIECBAgILD8AAECBAgQIEAgFhBYMag5AgQIECBAgIDA8gMECBAgQIAAgVhAYMWg5ggQIECAAAECAssPECBAgAABAgRiAYEVg5ojQIAAAQIECAgsP0CAAAECBAgQiAUEVgxqjgABAgQIECAgsPwAAQIECBAgQCAWEFgxqDkCBAgQIECAgMDyAwQIECBAgACBWEBgxaDmCBAgQIAAAQICyw8QIECAAAECBGIBgRWDmiNAgAABAgQICCw/QIAAAQIECBCIBQRWDGqOAAECBAgQICCw/AABAgQIECBAIBYQWDGoOQIECBAgQICAwPIDBAgQIECAAIFYQGDFoOYIECBAgAABAgLLDxAgQIAAAQIEYgGBFYOaI0CAAAECBAgILD9AgAABAgQIEIgFBFYMao4AAQIECBAgILD8AAECBAgQIEAgFhBYMag5AgQIECBAgIDA8gMECBAgQIAAgVhAYMWg5ggQIECAAAECAssPECBAgAABAgRiAYEVg5ojQIAAAQIECAgsP0CAAAECBAgQiAUEVgxqjgABAgQIECAgsPwAAQIECBAgQCAWEFgxqDkCBAgQIECAgMDyAwQIECBAgACBWEBgxaDmCBAgQIAAAQICyw8QIECAAAECBGIBgRWDmiNAgAABAgQICCw/QIAAAQIECBCIBQRWDGqOAAECBAgQICCw/AABAgQIECBAIBYQWDGoOQIECBAgQICAwPIDBAgQIECAAIFYQGDFoOYIECBAgAABAgLLDxAgQIAAAQIEYgGBFYOaI0CAAAECBAgILD9AgAABAgQIEIgFBFYMao4AAQIECBAgILD8AAECBAgQIEAgFhBYMag5AgQIECBAgIDA8gMECBAgQIAAgVhAYMWg5ggQIECAAAECAssPECBAgAABAgRiAYEVg5ojQIAAAQIECAgsP0CAAAECBAgQiAUEVgxqjgABAgQIECAgsPwAAQIECBAgQCAWEFgxqDkCBAgQIECAgMDyAwQIECBAgACBWEBgxaDmCBAgQIAAAQICyw8QIECAAAECBGIBgRWDmiNAgAABAgQICC IBgRWDmiNAgAABAgQICCw/QIAAAQIECBCIBQRWDGqOAAECBAgQICCw/AABAgQIECBAIBYQWDGoOQIECBAgQICAwPIDBAgQIECAAIFYQGDFoOYIECBAgAABAgLLDxAgQIAAAQIEYgGBFYOaI0CAAAECBAgILD9AgAABAgQIEIgFBFYMao4AAQIECBAgILD8AAECBAgQIEAgFhBYMag5AgQIECBAgIDA8gMECBAgQIAAgVhAYMWg5ggQIECAAAECAssPECBAgAABAgRiAYEVg5ojQIAAAQIECAgsP0CAAAECBAgQiAUEVgxqjgABAgQIECAgsPwAAQIECBAgQCAWEFgxqDkCBAgQIECAgMDyAwQIECBAgACBWEBgxaDmCBAgQIAAAQICyw8QIECAAAECBGIBgRWDmiNAgAABAgQICCw/QIAAAQIECBCIBQRWDGqOAAECBAgQICCw/AABAgQIECBAIBYQWDGoOQIECBAgQICAwPIDBAgQIECAAIFYQGDFoOYIECBAgAABAgLLDxAgQIAAAQIEYgGBFYOaI0CAAAECBAgILD9AgAABAgQIEIgFBFYMao4AAQIECBAgILD8AAECBAgQIEAgFhBYMag5AgQIECBAgIDA8gMECBAgQIAAgVhAYMWg5ggQIECAAAECAssPECBAgAABAgRiAYEVg5ojQIAAAQIECAgsP0CAAAECBAgQiAUEVgxqjgABAgQIECAgsPwAAQIECBAgQCAWEFgxqDkCBAgQIECAgMDyAwQIECBAgACBWEBgxaDmCBAgQIAAAQICyw8QIECAAAECBGIBgRWDmiNAgAABAgQICCw/QIAAAQIECBCIBQRWDGqOAAECBAgQICCw/AABAgQIECBAIBYQWDGoOQIECBAgQICAwPIDBAgQIECAAIFYQGDFoOYIECBAgAABAgLLDxAgQIAAAQIEYgGBFYOaI0CAAAECBAgILD9AgAABAgQIEIgFBFYMao4AAQIECBAgILD8AAECBAgQIEAgFhBYMag5AgQIECBAgIDA8gMECBAgQIAAgVhAYMWg5ggQIECAAAECAssPECBAgAABAgRiAYEVg5ojQIAAAQIECAgsP0CAAAECBAgQiAUEVgxqjgABAgQIECAgsPwAAQIECBAgQCAWEFgxqDkCBAgQIECAgMDyAwQIECBAgACBWEBgxaDmCBAgQIAAAQICyw8QIECAAAECBGIBgRWDmiNAgAABAgQICCw/QIAAAQIECBCIBQRWDGqOAAECBAgQICCw/AABAgQIECBAIBYQWDGoOQIECBAgQICAwPIDBAgQIECAAIFYQGDFoOYIECBAgAABAgLLDxAgQIAAAQIEYgGBFYOaI0CAAAECBAgILD9AgAABAgQIEIgFBFYMao4AAQIECBAgILD8AAECBAgQIEAgFhBYMag5AgQIECBAgIDA8gMECBAgQIAAgVhAYMWg5ggQIECAAAECAssPECBAgAABAgRiAYEVg5ojQIAAAQIECAgsP0CAAAECBAgQiAUEVgxqjgABAgQIECAgsPwAAQIECBAgQCAWEFgxqDkCBAgQIECAgMDyAwQIECBAgACBWEBgxaDmCBAgQIAAAQICyw8QIECAAAECBGIBgRWDmiNAgAABAgQICCw/QIAAAQIECBCIBQRWDGqOAAECBAgQICCw/AABAgQIECBAIBYQWDGoOQIECBAgQICAwPIDBAgQIECAAIFYQGDFoOYIECBAgAABAgLLDxAgQIAAAQIEYgGBFYOaI0CAAAECBAgILD9AgAABAgQIEIgFBFYMao4AAQIECBAgILD8AAECBAgQIEAgFhBYMag5AgQIECBAgIDA8gMECBAgQIAAgVhAYMWg5ggQIECAAAECAssPECBAgAABAgRiAYEVg5ojQIAAAQIECAgsP0CAAAECBAgQiAUEVgxqjgABAgQIECAgsPwAAQIECBAgQCAWEFgxqDkCBAgQIECAgMDyAwQIECBAgACBWEBgxaDmCBAgQI <span style="color: rgb(179, 179, 179); font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, &quot;Segoe UI&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif, &quot;Apple Color Emoji&quot;, &quot;Segoe UI Emoji&quot;, &quot;Segoe UI Symbol&quot;; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; background-color: rgb(38, 38, 38); text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial; display: inline !important; float: none;">n’t do it with style, you might as well not try.</span>






http://www.tiddlytools.com/#SectionLinksPlugin






The Years the world






* [[Dice Mechanics]]
* [[Taking Action]]
* [[Taking Damage]]
* [[Abilities]]
* [[Foci]]
* [[Exploits]]
* [[Style Points]]






Throughout this document there will be the short phrases of “roll the dice” or “dice pool”.  CHROMODROME is intended to be played with multiple special 10-sided polyhedral dice. If you do not yet have 10-sided dice, feel free to use the typical 6-sided dice found in many board games.  The rules themselves will note where this might change the rules.

Each character has 10 [[Abilities]] that describe them, which range from value of 1 to 10 or higher.  Character’s will also have [[Foci]] that they are trained or a experts in.  When the rules say to roll a dice pool for the action, follow the following procedure:

#The GM or rule states the key ability the character should use to complete the action.
#The player chooses the most appropriate focus the character is using to complete the action, if there is one.
#The player rolls a pool of dice equal in number to the value of the key attribute.
#The player counts the number of die below or equal to a value determined by the training level of the focus the player chose.
#The player compares the number of success to the value determined by the GM or rules to approximate the probability of success.

This rule governs virtually all action resolutions in [[CHROMODROME]].  See [[Taking Action]] to see the effects of this rule in further detail.







[[The Net]] can be used for a plethora of reasons. The more unscrupulous contract criminal uses the Net in a manner not intended by the megacorporations that manage it and use it. The every day citizen uses the Net to push information from one comm to another device through connecting to Net nodes scattered through the Texaplex. This way they can communicate long distance with others for business and friendship, watch netertainment, receive news updates, download SimStims, download programs, receive software updates from publishers, or take educational courses. If it's digital information, it can be acquired and moved through the Net. You only have access to the information that your NetAccess contract provides. Every person who has a comm also has a general NetAccess contract, and virtually everyone has a comm.  [[Corpos]] and wage slaves have recent model and manufactured comms, but others buy second hand or refabbed models. Some of the poorest or most anti-corp may use comms handmade by [[Tekeds]] or from a hodgepodge of parts.

Some parts - The protected and private parts - are protected by [[IC|Intrusive Countermeasures]] and are restricted to users of particular rolls. The levels vary, but usually guest users only have access to read public non-sensitive data and only the ability to complete forms. General Users may have the ability to add and edit their own files in their designated network drive, and a few admins have near virtual control over the Net nodes that have control over. Within each of these levels, agent roles may be assigned to particular users so that they have access to particular nodes and use more specialized programs and protocols in the nodes.

!!Via [[Virtual Reality]]

While taking actions in the Net in VR, you don't have as much freedom to do action but with a cyberdeck or terminal doing your processing your central nervous system is protected. In VR you can gain access from any designated or net enabled device. You can use any program or protocol of a user with your access level or a special role, or any you were able to sneak in past IC. You retain some awareness of your surroundings, suffering only 1 burn on rolls regarding your awareness. You also retain physical control over your body and can move in the Real while also taking actions in the Net, but may find doing so disconcerting or clumsy.

Meanwhile, in the Net, you can only act in the nodes that you are in and are only aware of things in the Net that are in the same node as you. You can also only move from node to node as they are connected to one another by Net protocol and the physical connections themselves. You can also disconnect from the Net by a quick action, and when you take harm, your terminal or cyberdeck takes the harm instead, rendering it unusable until the net time you spend time to regain SP.

!!Via [[Cyberspace]]

Through the use of neural electrics such as a neural jack or electrodes, a person is able to integrate their consciousness with the electronic information found in the Net. They give up the protects and uses of VR and terminals, for the freedom of being able to look over the location and flow of data from the outside. To enter cyberspace a cowboy or jockey interfaces with the Net somewhere that digital information is being exchanged. This is usually at some input. Some people use a cyber deck for hygiene and memory storage reasons, but they could use any place with a Net access input and attempt to interface.

While in Cyberspace, you are able to move your conscious anywhere else in the Net that you can perceive. The farther away your target is in the Net the longer it takes for your consciousness to reach it. You can also perform simple actions with your thoughts, use programs saved in PAN, and can conceal your presence all through the use of recycling data from your surroundings, unlike with VR. As you use this data, it means that it might not reach it's intended location or become corrupted. This is usually no problem on the usual Net, but in networks of nodes with a limited and regulated amount of data in it can be a red flag of an intrusive presence in Cyberspace. Also, if a node network runs out of usable data, it can leave the cowboy or jockey stuck in Cyberspace until more data arrives or someone is able to locate them and boot them out and return them to their body.

Unfortunately, this addictive existence leaves your body vulnerable. You lose all control of your physical body while interfacing in the Net. You also must reach an outgoing node in the Net to return to your body. These are usually something that generates something in the real world, such as a radio broadcast, a printer, a speaker or screen, or anything else that converts digital information into a physical representation in the real world. The biggest danger though is the adverse effects that IC has on a cowboy if hit with a digital attack in the Net. Any harm suffered is suffered by the cowboy or jockey, which leads to being unconscious if not dead.

MDAwIG4NCjAwMDAwNzUwMzIgMDAwMDAgbg0KMDAwMDEwNjIwMCAwMDAwMCBuDQowMDAwMTExOTA5IDAwMDAwIG4NCjAwMDAxMTIyMTcgMDAwMDAgbg0KdHJhaWxlcgo8PAovSW5mbyA5IDAgUgovUm9vdCAxIDAgUgovU2l6ZSAxMAo+PgpzdGFydHhyZWYKMTEyMzc2CiUlRU9GCg==






There are many ways to move around [[The Texaplex]], and one of them is with your own vehicle. Most vehicles, in order to accommodate the parking issues of modern cities are compact and electric powered. The most common are motorbikes, two-door cars, but Vans and Trucks still make their way through the city. Large vehicles such as six-axles and semi trucks stick to major roadways and parking at dispersing centers.

Each vehicle has their own occupancy limits. the first is the normal occupancy in which it can be used without burn. the second is the maximum number of people able to be moved by the vehicle.

!!__Compact__
!!!!Movement via Medium VIII (requires concentration, area of effect i) -- 44 SC

When driving and operating this vehicle, it takes a complex action every turn to move up to a rate of roughly 120 kilometers per hour, 35 meters per second, and 350 meters per round. A compact car can be occupied by 2 people at a time.

!!__Hyper__
!!!!Movement via Medium XXII (requires concentration, area of effect i) -- 121 SC

You are speed, quicker than quick. You are lightning speed. While the conversion of electric motors left some horsepowers on the chopping block floor, hypercars earned it all back. The Ferrari E50 and the Mitzubishi Blur are two such models with such impressive power and sleek arrow and wedge shaped designs. Such cars are not available to the typical consumer, but executive corpos with deeps pockets can buy these cars originally intended for sports car races and bring them to the streets.  As a complex action when driving and operating this vehicle, you amd one other person occupying the hypercar can  move up to a rate of roughly 330 kilometers per hour, 90 meters per second, and 900 meters per round.

!!__Motorbike__
!!!!Movement via Medium XI (requires concentration) -- 27 SC

It’s a motorbike: simple, compact and powerful. Normally used by one person, it can accommodate one additional person at the cost of 1 burn for the driver's ability to operate the motorbike. With the dissolution of the nuclear family, and a vast reduction in the amount of affordable parking space available in urban centers, motorbikes have become a de facto means of personal transportation for many persons in the Texaplex. Typical makes and models include the Suzuki X3400, the Ford Thunderbird, the Chevy Eido, the Mitzuhama Roc-zuka. When driving and operating this vehicle, it takes a complex action every turn to move up to a rate of roughly 165 kilometers per hour, 40 meters per second, and 400 meters per round.

!!__Sport__
!!!!Movement via Medium XI (requires concentration, area of effect i) -- 60 SC

Ride in style and ride fast. These powerful cars come in coupe and roadster styles and can transport you and one other occupant at very fast speeds between other cars and across lanes. When driving and operating this vehicle, it takes a complex action every turn to move up to a rate of roughly 165 kilometers per hour, 40 meters per second, and 400 meters per round. The most common models of sport cars include the Tigra Panther, the Ford GT650, The Mitzuhama Milan, and the Amerimotor Gladiator XR.


!!__Smartboard__
!!!!Movement via Medium III (requires concentration), Aid (increase time ii) -- 20 SC

What every kid needs to skate down the bending hill streets of San Angeles. A smartboard is a motor powered skateboard fused with radar and laser technologies that can be ridden by a sole rider. When riding and operating this vehicle, it takes a complex action every turn to move up to a rate of roughly 45 kilometers per hour, 12.5 meters per second, and 125 meters per round. The smart board comes with an specialized wheels and axle system that detects and shifts to provide a smooth ride over road hazards, such as potholes, dead rats, and the stray chunk of rubber. You ignore 1 burn on controlling the board in hazardous road conditions.

!!__Rocket Wheels__
!!!!Movement via Medium IV (requires concentration) -- 20 SC

While they are not literal rockets, they are wheels that will rocket you forward. They are roller blades on Whizz. Couriers and street kids of all sorts use them for intrablock travels and Xtreme sports. As a complex action while using rocket boots are on your feet, you can move up to a rate of roughly 60 kilometers per hour, 17 meters per second, and 170 meters per round.

!!__Truck, pick-up__
!!!!Movement via Medium VIII (requires concentration, area of effect i), Has Hardpoints II -- 58 SC

When driving and operating this vehicle, it takes a complex action every turn to move up to a rate of roughly 120 kilometres per hour, 35 meters per second, and 350 meters per round. A compact car can be occupied by 2 people at a time. This truck has a truck bed which can be used to haul additional gear and for storage. but it also has various mounts to allow for the pulling of moderate trailers or as a attachment for mounting additional seating, shelter, or field equipment.

!!__Truck, box__
!!!!Movement via Medium VIII (requires concentration, area of effect iv, restricted) -- 68 SC

When driving and operating this vehicle, it takes a complex action every turn to move up to a rate of roughly 120 kilometres per hour, 35 meters per second, and 350 meters per round. A Box Truck has a cab that can seat 3 persons, and a segregated area with a rectilinear volume of 80 cubed meters. being large, this vehicle is difficult to control and turn in tight corners. The driver experiences 1 burn of maneuvering the vehicle in tight corridors and turns.

!!__Van__
!!!!Movement via Medium VIII (requires concentration, area of effect iv) -- 44 SC

When driving and operating this vehicle, it takes a complex action every turn to move up to a rate of roughly 120 kilometres per hour, 35 meters per second, and 350 meters per round. A van can be occupied by 9 people and gear, with additional gear taking seating for people.











Referred to as ''VR'', virtual reality is a computer generated environment that hosts interactive experiences that provide sensory feedback. Immersive by design, the environments can be simulations of the real world but can also be variations or fantastical by design. the most common alteration is time dilation and gravity. Most corporate workers work in VR, as time can be modulated to allow persons to work relatively quicker or faster than in the real world - sometimes up to 60 times as fast for short periods of time. The ability for a network or terminal to provide VR is dependent on the computational power provided.

While in VR, a person controls and does actions through a specialized program call an avatar. An avatar is designed by a computer programmer, like everything else in VR. Some VR hosts limit the customization of the Avatar, or require the use of a generic avatar. Programs and functions that a person can execute depends on the access granted to that user by the system.  Should a user want to accomplish an action they will need to use a program, including moving around in VR, for the most part. Programs in VR have an appearance that is programmed to communicate its function and purpose. Many counter intruder programs will take the appearances of weapons, and tools will often take the appearance of their real world counter part. A save program may look like a filing cabinet, a data vault will look like a safe. and a document reader may look like a book, or tablet, and security daemons might look like policemen.







<<<
"Some times it not what you say. Sometimes its about yelling in pain and other people joining in on your pain that starts a movement"
<<<

```
//Faceman, Bard, the Devil, Mr(s). Broker, Honeypot, Geisha, Fixer, Jungilite, Noise, Rocker, Congeen, Aces, White-Hat, //
```

Characters belonging to this archetype are the smooth-talkers and pretty faces of the street.  They use their powerful style-sense, vocallity and charm to get things done. they bring people to their side with words. They are more adept at being asked in rather than breaking in. They know what they want and use others to get it done for them. Some do it only for themselves, but many voice become the voices of their people or in-group. But what separates a voice from the usual charismatic person is their ability to be empathetic, convince others to do things not in their best interest, to beleive in something again, and their ability to convince the group or masses rather than just one person.

!!![[Abilities]] and [[Foci]]
Choose one ability array from below:

| 3 | !Athletics | 2 |
| 5 | !Charm | 4 |
| 4 | !Coersive | 5 |
| 5 | !Cool | 5 |
| 4 | !Coordination | 4 |
| 4 | !Empathy | 3 |
| 2 | !Hearty | 3 |
| 3 | !Luck | 3 |
| 3 | !Smarts | 4 |
| 4 | ! Perception | 4 |

Choose one array from below for the ranking of your character's foci:

| Finagle | !Expert | Deceive |
| Provoke |~| Finagle |
| Books | !Moderate | Killswitch |
| Deceive |~| Provoke |
| Killswitch |~| Skulduggery |
| Sleuth |~| Sleuth |
| Stunts |~| Stunts |
| Case | !Basic | Books |
| Light Weapons |~| Brawl |
| Skulduggery |~| Wipe |

!!!Typical Equipment
*Media Gear
*Social digital gear
*Musical Equipment
*Social Pheramones
*Social Drugs
*Social Inhibitors
*Cosmetics
*Fashionable Clothing
*Disguises

[[Exploits]]

!!!!Chrome Tounge
When a roll is called for your charcter social interaction, you can spend 5 SP to reduce burn if any by 1 and gain edge.

!!!!Quipy
Whenever you regain style from saying a cool one-liner, up to a number of people equal to your Charm that could hear you regain 3 style each. 

!!!!Hypeman
As a complex action, you can spend 3 SP to brag or talk about a character to increase their SP. Roll Charm or Cool, and the person you are hyping regains 3 SP per success. 

!!!!Audiensure
You ignore one burn on rolls due to talking to multiple people at the same time.

!!!!Center of Attention
You have edge on rolls to gain attention.

!!!!Knows the audience
Select a type of style when you choose this skill. You have strong influence on persons of that style and roll with edge when rolling against them.

!!!!This is Junk
Spend 10 style to create a single use consumable piece of tech out of the junk around you as a complex action. The gear must be simple in use and composition.

!!!!Signal in the Noise
You can speak across loud distances and over others more effectively. You ignore 1 burn due to talking across long distance, over loud sounds, and through faulty or jammed equipment.






The ''Weather and Air Monitoring Authority'', or WAMA, serves as a public health agency that monitors the air quality and releases a daily notice regarding air quality and health hazards, and recommended safety guides. Many residence, particularly those outside the geodesic domes or without access to environmentally-controlled spaces pay close attention to WAMA due to the hazards of [[The Dust]].






In a roleplaying game, you are one of multiple people who are part storyteller, part actor, part character, and part audience.  You and the other players you play with create and play through imaginary stories filled with tension, villains, gunfights, corporate wage slaves, and cybernetically enhanced badasses with a few adventures, fantasies and crime lords thrown in for good measure.  However, a roleplaying game is principally a game, and when characters are challenged, we rely on dice to dictate the direction of tense or dramatic directions by simulating the uncertainty that we experience when watching a movie or reading a book for the first time.

In [[CHROMODROME]], you play a character on the edge of an alternative history’s future society. You and your character are out for something; typically power or control in a dark cyberpunk future where you don’t have either.  

To play you will need:

* 2+ players
* Your imagination
* Papers and pencils
* A handful of 6-sided or 10-sided dice

One player out of all the players has a unique responsibility as the [[Game Master|Being a Game Master]] or ''GM'', which will need to be decided before play of the game.  No player must always be the GM, but players typically remain the GM until the current narrative or story is completed.  The role of the GM does not typically change in the middle of a story line. The role of GM from one game meet-up typically continues into the next game meet-up or “game session” until an ending is developed.
